doc:
Danny Little Bear https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danny_Little_Bear 0 Danny Little Bear (September 13, 1925 – May 12, 1991) was an American professional wrestler who competed in North American regional promotions including the National Wrestling Alliance, particularly the Central States and Gulf Coast territories, where he remained one of the region's most popular stars during the 1960s and 70s. His feuds with Yasu Fuji Chati Yokochi, Black Angus Campbell and manager Percival A. Friend and Eduardo Miguel Perez were the cause of frequent riots and arrests in the St. Joseph-Kansas City area during the summer of 1972. He also had a successful stint in Stu Hart's Stampede Wrestling, holding the promotions Stampede Wrestling North American Heavyweight Championship for much of early 1974. Danny_Little_Bear ( September_13_,_1925 – May_12_,_1991 ) was an_American_professional_wrestler who competed in North_American_regional_promotions including the_National_Wrestling_Alliance , particularly the_Central_States_and_Gulf_Coast_territories , where he remained one of the_region 's most_popular stars during the_1960s_and_70s . His_feuds with Yasu_Fuji_ , Black_Angus_Campbell and manager_Percival_A._Friend and Eduardo_Miguel_Perez were the_cause of frequent_riots_and_arrests in the_St._Joseph-Kansas_City_area during the_summer of 1972 . He also had a_successful_stint in Stu_Hart 's_Stampede_Wrestling , holding the_promotions_Stampede_Wrestling_North_American_Heavyweight_Championship for much of early_1974 .
